# uptimekuma_settings (Resource)

Manages Uptime Kuma server settings. This is a singleton resource — only one instance should exist per Uptime Kuma server. Deleting this resource only removes it from Terraform state; the settings persist on the server.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Manage Uptime Kuma server settings
resource "uptimekuma_settings" "main" {
  server_timezone        = "Europe/Berlin"
  keep_data_period_days  = 30
  check_update           = true
  search_engine_index    = false
  entry_page             = "dashboard"
  nscd                   = true
  tls_expiry_notify_days = [7, 14, 21]
  trust_proxy            = false
}

# Minimal example: only manage specific settings
resource "uptimekuma_settings" "minimal" {
  server_timezone       = "UTC"
  keep_data_period_days = 7
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `check_update` (Boolean) Enable automatic update checks.
- `chrome_executable` (String) Path to Chrome/Chromium executable for Real Browser monitoring.
- `entry_page` (String) Entry page shown after login (e.g. `dashboard`).
- `keep_data_period_days` (Number) Number of days to keep monitoring data.
- `nscd` (Boolean) Enable NSCD (Name Service Cache Daemon) for DNS caching.
- `primary_base_url` (String) Primary base URL for the Uptime Kuma instance.
- `search_engine_index` (Boolean) Allow search engines to index the status pages.
- `server_timezone` (String) Server timezone (e.g. `Europe/Berlin`).
- `steam_api_key` (String, Sensitive) Steam API key for Steam Game Server monitoring.
- `tls_expiry_notify_days` (List of Number) Days before TLS certificate expiry to send notifications (e.g. `[7, 14, 21]`).
- `trust_proxy` (Boolean) Trust reverse proxy headers.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Settings identifier (always `settings`).
